Package stochasticSimulation

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • stochasticSimulation.Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGrid

    public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGrid
    The Grid class which implements the Gird interface. In the context of a StochasticSimulation it is used to host the individuals of a Population, that can find a shortest path between points by moving and evolving within the grid.
    Author:
    Manuel Serra

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected int cmax
      the maximum cost of a move in the grid.

      Point representing the goal if a best path is to be found.

      an array of Obstacles that are present in the grid configuration.
      protected SpecialZone[] spZones
      an array of SpecialZones which are present in the grid configuration.

        M - is the number of rows in the grid.

      • Grid

            int M,
            int C,
            SpecialZone[] spZones)
        Constructor for a grid with no obstacles but with special zones.
        Parameters:

        M - is the number of rows in the grid.
        C - is the maximum cost of a special zone.
        spZones - is an array of the special zones existing in the grid.

        C - is the maximum cost of a special zone.
        spZones - is an array of the special zones existing in the grid.
        obstacles - is an array of the obstacles existing in the grid.

    • Method Detail

      • findBestPath

        public void findBestPath​(Point origin,
                         Point goal,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
        This method allows the best path between to Points in a grid to be found. It instantiates a StochasticShortestPath and runs the simulate() method. Redefinitions of the method can be made to compute the best path between two points with other algorithms such as Dijkstra's algorithm.
        Specified by:
        findBestPath in interface IGrid
        Parameters:
        origin - is the initial point of the shortest path to be found.
        goal - is the destination point of the shortest path to be found.
        params - are the parameters to initialize the StochasticsShortestPath object.

      • step

        public void step​(Individual ind)
        This method allows allows an individual of the population of a stochasticSimulation to give steps in the grid. It checks the valid moves according to the grids limits and obstacles and selects a random move from the pool of valid moves. After the move is selected the position of the individual is changes accordingly. If no valid move is found the position is maintained as it was.
        Specified by:
        step in interface IGrid
        Parameters:
        ind - is the individual that will give a step in the grid.

      • getStepCost

        protected int getStepCost​(Point origin,
                          Point destination)
        This method computes the cost of a step in the grid, according to the grid costs. Since the costs are set for each square in costMap, the move cost can be computed as follows: 1) a move has cost 1 if the origin or destination of the move has cost 1. 2) a move has cost different than one if it is taken between two squares of cost different than one. In this case the cost of the move is the cost of the destination square. The moves are coded as follows: 0 - up ; 1 - right ; 2 - down ; 3 - left
        Parameters:
        origin - is the initial point of the step
        destination - is the final point of the step
        Returns:
        An integer with the cost of the step

      • getValidMoves

        protected java.lang.Integer[] getValidMoves​(Point indPosition)
        This method retrieves the possible moves from a position given as input. It tries out every move and checks if the resulting position is an object or is out of the grid's bounds. If so, the move is invalid, otherwise it's a valid move. The moves are coded as follows: 0 - up ; 1 - right ; 2 - down ; 3 - left
        Parameters:
        indPosition - the Point where the move is taking place from.
        Returns:
        An Integer array with the predefined codes of the valid moves.

      • isObstacle

        private boolean isObstacle​(Point point)
        This method tells if a given point in the grid is an obstacle.
        Parameters:
        point - is the point that the method must tell if it is an obstacle or not
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating that the point is an obstacle if true or not, if false.

      • getDistanceToGoal

        protected int getDistanceToGoal​(Point point)
        This method computes the distance between a point and the goal in hops, independently of the presence of obstacles.
        Parameters:
        point - the point from where the distance to the goal is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        An integer with the value of the distance.

      • setCostMap

        protected void setCostMap​()
        This method initializes the cost map according to the special cost zones array. It assumes that the cost map is implemented as a table so it would have to be redefined if a different implementation is desired.

      • newCostMap

        protected void newCostMap​()
        This method declares a new cost map with the grid dimensions.
